alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 20 at 9:03PM PST until February 23 at 3:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TUESDAY TO 3 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 12 to 18 feet with dangerous rip currents. Highest across west and northwest facing beaches. Surf will peak overnight Tuesday into early Wednesday morning. * WHERE...San Luis Obispo County Beaches and Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches. * WHEN...From noon Tuesday to 3 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minor Coastal flooding is possible due to the combination of high tides and large swells Tuesday night and Wednesday morning. High tides will be 5.2-5.6 feet occuring around 1130 PM Tuesday and 1100 AM on Wednesday.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Beaches; Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches
